description.narrative: Community actors have improved capacity to provide quality nutrition-promotion and counselling services to adolescents and women of childbearing age, especially those marginalized and in humanitarian situations., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, adolescents and women, especially the most vulnerable and those affected by shocks, have increased access to and the utilization of promotional, preventive and curative nutrition services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community actors have improved capacity to provide quality nutrition-promotion and counselling services to adolescents and women ofchildbearing age, especially those marginalized and in humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: Un total de 111 272 enfants a bénéficié de la promotion de l’alimentation optimale du nourrisson et du jeune enfant et du développement de la petite enfance avec l’appui de 16 498 relais communautaires et 12 367 groupes de soutien. La mise en œuvre de la stratégie de renforcement de capacité «;faible dose et haute fréquence;» (courtes formations répétées dans le temps) se poursuit auprès de 1055 relais communautaires. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/12/2021

title.narrative: Percentage of health districts implementing a minimum package to prevent chronic malnutrition (out of 72 districts), Percent
Existence of an evaluated pilot on low-dose high-frequency training of community volunteers. (65005), Text
Existence of a communication strategy to promote behaviors change on feeding practices based on the results of a socio-anthropological study. (65006), Text
